result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven M Rempala was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and Stayed. Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.
Imposed and Stayed. Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

Amended 6/27/2022 to change probation length from 3 years to 1 year
Concurrent with: 21CF280

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation. No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be monitored by random UA's & breathalyzers & community contacts. Any prescription must be taken as prescribed. No contact with drug dealers or users. Do not drive unless properly licensed. Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment and or schooling or 15 hours of community service each week the defendant is not in school or working.

10:31 AM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Steven M Rempala in court, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Steven M Rempala. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - 21CF280 Cts 1, 2 & 3- NO CONTEST. 
22CF70 Cts 1 & 2- NO CONTEST. 
Factual basis found in complaint. 
BTC: 21CF280 Cts 1, 2 & 3 GUILTY. 22CF70 Cts 1 & 2 GUILTY with Cts 3-5 being dismissed and read in. 21CF62, 21CF1828, 22CF72 and 21CF652 will be dismissed and read in. 
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 
Defendant gives statement. 

BTC: 
21CF280-
Ct 1-
2 years Wisconsin State Prison bifurcated 1 initial confinement with 1 extended supervision imposed and stayed. 
3 years probation.

Conditions of probation:
120 days Racine County Jail STAYED
Absolute sobriety. No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be
monitored by random UA's & breathalyzers & community contacts. Any prescription must be taken as prescribed. 
Any assessments/counseling/treatment deemed appropriate by agent.
Obtain/maintain full-time employment and or schooling.
15 hours of community service if not employed or in school. 
Do not drive unless properly licensed. 
No contact with drug dealers or users. 
Firearm warning.
Voting warning.
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA Surcharge

Defendant is eligible for CIP
Defendant is eligible for SAP. 

Ct 2-
4 years Wisconsin State Prison bifurcated 2 initial confinement with 2 extended supervision imposed and stayed. 
3 years probation.

Ct 3-
Sentence withheld. 
30 days Racine County Jail imposed and stayed. 
1 year probation.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:: No contact with the victim C.A.G (person, property, residence or family). Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
